name: Warmaster and Champion of Clan Ironaxe (FTR 9/WM 7/COT 24)
author: Fist

posts.author: Theophilus Fist
posts.content:
There are only 3 examples of this class combo using Dwarf in the database and all of the others focus heavily on WM.  

STRENGTHS: Strong AB of 46, Dev Crit DC of 41, high saves keep him from getting dev critted and will make almost every save against spells.  Blindfight and high Spot to combat sneaks.  Decent enough HP to survive until he lands a Dev Crit, decent base damage if he faces crit immunes.  With CHA gear can access +9 Divine Wrath for up to 4 rounds

WEAKNESSES: No Evasion, no self buffing, mediocre AC, no DR, not enough CHA to make use of COT goodies.

Warmaster!  Dwarf, any non-Evil (I'm generally playing along the Good axis).

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
If you are willing to sacrifice +1 saves you can pick up another feat in epic with Ftr10.  IKD would be handy. Or Called Shot or take your pick. 

The odd thing is, I couldn't replicate your build using the CBC because Dwarven Waraxe didn't appear on the dropdown list of viable EWS weapons @Lvl 30.  Please, other members please verify this because I may need to message Kamiryn about the bug. Or at least it seems a bug to me.  I know no reason why the CoT version of EWS doesn't recognize the Exotic Proficiency but it does NOT with my version of CBC.  I am assuming you at least tested this build in-game just to make sure before posting, TF.

That's why I was forced to insert a fighter level just to check the layout.  The fighter version worked fine so something is rotten in Denmark (or wherever Kamiryn lives).

If I were to use the build, the extra feat would be of more value.  Don't forget that, even on low magic, common items contain boosts to saves, often in combination with other enhancements, so the saves from 23 levels of CoT is plenty.  Your toon can still gain up to +2 saves by simply chugging down Owl, Cat & Endurance potions that will last a few hours.

I do like an early DevCrit if going that route. You accomplished that nicely even though slightly feat-starved via the investment into race and special proficiency.  Good job altogether!

posts.author: HipRedux
posts.content:
I quite agree. Pre-epic would have been my choice as well to expand the feat potential. 

Like I said, it was a burp using the CBC that forced me to explore the sequence at that point differently in your posted build. 

I am quite confident that should you use CoT to grab EWS from any weapon proficiency at all there's no reason it wouldn't work. That's what is set in the feat.2da. But rather than confirm the feat selection using my trainer, I am interested to find whether the anomaly expressed in (what I assume is) the latest version of the CBC can be verified by other users of Kamiryn's spreadsheet. It's possible the conversion from .xlsx to .xls format corrupted some functionality of which I am not aware (I don't like running the MSOffice 2007 version of CBC so converted it).

posts.content:
So I'm replaying as FTR10/WM8/COT22 with FTR 9-10 at LVLs 15 and 16, KD at 16 and IKD at 20.  WM 7 goes at LVL 21 and WM 8 at LVL 37.

As Hip suggested, -1 to saves for a pickup of IKD and 1 more Ki Damage usage (not sure that Ki Damage is much help at Level 37, but it's something).
